name: ineligible
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not allowed to do or have something, according to particular rules: be declared ineligible for He was declared ineligible for the competition because he worked for the company that ran it.ineligible to Many people became ineligible to receive aid because their earnings were above the new limit.

Related word
ineligibility
Add to word list
Add to word list
not allowed by the rules: [ + to infinitive ] After serving two terms, the president was ineligible to run again.
Add to word list
Add to word list
not allowed to do or receive something because you do not meet certain conditions: The state has made a reasonable effort to help purge ineligible voters from election rolls.ineligible to do sth His weak credit and low income make him ineligible to refinance his loan.ineligible for sth The Pensions Office tells me we are ineligible for a joint pension. Compare
eligible ineligibility noun [ U ] uk/ɪˌnelɪdʒəˈbɪlɪti/ us/-tIi/
All public records conclusively establish his ineligibility to be a candidate for office.
